title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct geometry and a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· The molecular geometry is see-saw. Given the asymmetric arrangement of atoms relative to the lone pair of electrons, it is impossible for all of the individual bond dipoles to cancel completely.

The response provides both the correct geometry and a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· The molecular geometry is see-saw. Given the asymmetric arrangement of atoms relative to the lone pair of electrons, it is impossible for all of the individual bond dipoles to cancel completely.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that both substances have London dispersion forces.

· Both substances experience comparable London dispersion forces, but XeO 2 F 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E25@ additionally has dipole-dipole attractions. The total intermolecular forces among molecules of XeO 2 F 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E25@ are stronger than those among molecules of XeO 3 F 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E26@ , leading to a higher melting point for XeO 2 F 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E25@ .
